title: Swap AppHeader logo to generated neon-green music note icon (no layout/functionality changes)

requirements.summary: Swap the AppHeader logo image to a neon-green music note (white outline) while keeping all existing header layout/sizing classes unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The header icon renders as a neon-green music note with a white outline.
The icon occupies the same space as before (same container size, same alignment, same spacing).
No other header elements (title/subtitle/messages button/menu button) visually shift due to this change.

file_operations.description: Update only the header src to point to the new static asset (frontend/public/assets/generated/header-music-note.dim_128x128.png) while keeping the existing wrapper and image classes (e.g., w-10 h-10, flex layout, gaps, padding) and all click handlers/props untouched.

requirements.summary: Add the new music-note PNG under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it directly from AppHeader without backend involvement.
acceptanceCriteria: A new PNG icon file exists at `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and is used by `AppHeader`.
The header icon loads reliably (no broken image placeholder).

file_operations.description: Add the generated PNG asset (transparent background; neon-green music note with white outline) at this exact path/filename so AppHeader can reference it directly via (no backend routing).
Ensure the src references /assets/generated/header-music-note.dim_128x128.png directly (static public asset) and does not change any other header structure or styling.

requirements.summary: Ensure no header navigation behavior or functionality changes occur as part of the icon swap.
acceptanceCriteria: All header buttons (menu toggle if present, messages button) behave exactly as before.
No routes, screen navigation, or click handlers are changed as part of this update.

file_operations.description: Add a short implementation note documenting that this change must remain a src-only icon swap in AppHeader (no changes to navigation, routes, or click handlers), to prevent accidental functional regressions in future edits.
